events.event_description: U.S. developers plan to add 62.8 GW of new utility-scale electric-generating capacity in 2024, with solar accounting for 58% and battery storage for 23% of additions.
events.citation: Developers and power plant owners plan to add 62.8 gigawatts (GW) of new utility-scale electric-generating capacity in 2024, according to our latest Preliminary Monthly Electric Generator Inventory. We expect solar to account for the largest share of new capacity in 2024, at 58%, followed by battery storage, at 23%.

events.event_description: The Gemini solar facility in Nevada, expected to be the largest solar project in the U.S., plans to begin operations with 690 MW solar capacity and 380 MW battery storage.
events.citation: Outside of these states, the Gemini solar facility in Nevada plans to begin operating in 2024. With a planned photovoltaic capacity of 690 megawatts (MW) and battery storage of 380 MW, it is expected to be the largest solar project in the United States when fully operational.

events.event_description: The Menifee Power Bank battery storage facility (460 MW) is scheduled to come online at former natural gas plant site in Riverside, California.
events.citation: Developers have scheduled the Menifee Power Bank (460.0 MW) at the site of the former Inland Empire Energy Center natural gas-fired power plant in Riverside, California, to come on line in 2024.

events.event_description: South Fork Wind, a 130-MW offshore wind plant off New York's coast, is scheduled to begin commercial operation.
events.citation: South Fork Wind, which developers expected to begin commercial operation last year, is now scheduled to come on line in March 2024.

events.event_description: Vineyard Wind 1, an 800-MW offshore wind plant off Massachusetts coast, is scheduled to begin operations.
events.citation: Two large offshore wind plants scheduled to come on line this year are the 800-MW Vineyard Wind 1 off the coast of Massachusetts

events.event_description: The fourth reactor (1.1 GW) at Georgia's Vogtle nuclear power plant is scheduled to start operations.
events.citation: Start-up of the fourth reactor (1.1 GW) at Georgia's Vogtle nuclear power plant, originally scheduled for last year, has moved to March 2024.
